title: Home
text:
Home - IFAD































Transforming rural communities for almost 50 years 




 Learn More
 











A better future starts in rural areas.  

















Highlights 














Rural Voices

 Soil is getting saltier – but African farmers are standing strong Farmers in western and southern Africa are building resilience to salinity through innovative approaches in their fields. 

  Read now 
           
 














Explainer

 5 investments that will help nourish the world Investing in small-scale agriculture and local food systems in low and middle-income countries is the best way to create nutritional security for all. 

  Learn more 
           
 















Rural Voices

 Forest bounty feeds the world Meet some of the rural people that IFAD works with to celebrate and nurture the bounty of our forests. 

  Read now 
           
 













Podcast

 Weathering the future - Episode 80 In this episode, we dive into the science and innovation shaping our interaction with the weather. 

  Tune-in 
           
 












News
28 March 2023

 After the earthquake in Türkiye, rural people need more support than ever Extreme weather events, such as droughts, storms and floods, are putting pressure on the ecosystems that farmers depend on... 

  Read More

 













Event
19 May 2025

 2025 IFAD Innovation Day: Innovation for Rural Transformation This year's IFAD Innovation Day will serve as a launchpad for a series of participatory consultations that will inform the development of our new innovation strategy. 

  Join in 
           
 













Publication

 Photobook: Growing stronger rural futures in Türkiye This photobook showcases the impact of two projects in Türkiye that were financed by IFAD alongside the Government of Türkiye: the Uplands Rural Development Programme (URDP) and the Göksu Taşeli Watershed Development Project (GTWDP). 

  Read now 
           
 













Publication

 Photobook: Fostering change in people’s lives in Liberia This photobook showcases the positive impact of IFAD-supported projects on Liberia’s rural communities, including the Tree Crops Extension Projects (TCEP-I and II) and the Smallholder Agriculture Transformation and Agribusiness Revitalization Project (STAR-P). 

  Read now 
           
 



















Interested in investing with us? 
 
Explore now
 








IFAD’s investments make a tangible difference in rural people’s lives
 




 See the difference
 














Our Impact in Numbers 







 Countries in which IFAD operates
 92










 Loans and grants provided to date
 US$ 24 B









 

People reached by ongoing IFAD-supported projects
 
 78.6 M








IFAD in the World 




















In Focus













Climate and environment
The lives of small-scale farmers are being upended by climate change. They need support to adapt to climate change and to protect the planet’s precious resources
 














Rural women
Gender inequality is one of the biggest impediments to sustainable development. Without tackling its root causes, we cannot end global hunger and poverty
 

















Remittances
The funds sent home by migrant workers are a lifeline for rural families, helping to build resilience and support sustainable development
 













Indigenous Peoples
With their traditional knowledge and deep connection to their environments, we work with Indigenous Peoples to build a more inclusive, sustainable future.
 

















Stay connected
Get the latest updates from IFAD.

In Focus













Climate and environment
The lives of small-scale farmers are being upended by climate change. They need support to adapt to climate change and to protect the planet’s precious resources
 














Rural women
Gender inequality is one of the biggest impediments to sustainable development. Without tackling its root causes, we cannot end global hunger and poverty
 

















Remittances
The funds sent home by migrant workers are a lifeline for rural families, helping to build resilience and support sustainable development
 













Indigenous Peoples
With their traditional knowledge and deep connection to their environments, we work with Indigenous Peoples to build a more inclusive, sustainable future.
